review: I had to look back at my order because I totally forgot that I bought a refurbished unit; the product looks new and operates like I was the first person to open the box and plug it in so NO NEGATIVES regarding that facet of the purchase. Buyer beware, I ignored the recommendations to get the extender cable for the HDMI because I needed it as the location was too tight to fit the stick with the mini usb power cable sticking out. So I went to Walgreens and bought cable ($8.00), brought it home and darnit, realized the HDMI cables are normally both male ends and the Roku is a male and the TV is a female. Sooo, went to Target where they sell Roku's ($45+) and found no special cables for the roku but did find a double male adapter ($18.00) that touts itself as a cable extender because you can join two HDMI.I got it up and running, set up is easy, a keyboard would be nice to put in email addresses and user names but otherwise an a easy setup. From plug in, start up and use, I didn't even get around to reading the setup documents that came in the box.For buying the Roku and a refurbished one at that, I would do it again.

review: I bought this unit for use in my bedroom, I currently have a Roku 3 out in the living room and I find this unit to be much much slower than the Roku 3. Even just browsing YouTube or waiting for Plex to load takes considerably longer than the 3 and is a bit frustrating at times.Otherwise the install was simple stupid and I love that you can power it from the TV's USB port.
